DataElement.preferredName: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Questionnaire How Much Feel Restless Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often they feel restless as if they have to be moving, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Questionnaire How Much Feel Restless Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey developed and copyrighted by A. S. Zigmond and R. P. Snaith in 1983, 1992, 1994 and published in the Acta Psychiatrica Scandinavica journal (A.S. Zigmond and R.P. Snaith. The Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. Acta psychiart. scand. 1983, 67:361-370) which is used to detect depression and anxiety in individuals in a hospital or medical outpatient clinic. This instrument is a self-administered questionnaire consisting of 14 items that assess how the individual has felt over the past week. Each item as 4 response options that are associated with a score of 0 to 3._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences._A question about whether an individual feels or has felt restless._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ReferenceDocuments.name: I feel restless as if I have
ReferenceDocuments.description: I feel restless as if I have to be on the move

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

DataElement.origin: HADS:Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, A.S.Zigmond and R.P.Snaith, Dec. 1982
DataElement.changeDescription: Created new version to correct reversed VM assignments. mc 8/18/15
